content.description: Directions: Read the following selection carefully for comprehension. The selection is followed by a number of related questions and incomplete statements. Select the best answer or completion.
content.question: Catullus sends a message. Poetae tenero, meo sodali, velim Caecilio, papyre, dicas Veronam veniat, Novi relinquens Comi moenia Lariumque litus. (5) Nam quasdam volo cogitationes amici accipiat sui meique. Quare, si sapiet, viam vorabit, quamvis candida milies puella euntem revocet, manusque collo (10) ambas iniciens roget morari. Quae nunc, si mihi vera nuntiantur, ilium deperit impotente amore. Nam quo tempore legit incohatam Dindymi dominam, ex eo misellae (15) ignes interiorem edunt medullam. Lines 8-9 (quamvis . . . revocet) are translated

choices.label: although his gorgeous girlfriend may call him back a thousand times as he is going
although his radiant girl begs a thousand times to go with him
since his radiant girl, like a soldier, may call him again while heâ€™s going
however, his pretty girlfriend sweetly shouts at him not to go

content.answer: although his gorgeous girlfriend may call him back a thousand times as he is going

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
